Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Status.NuGet.Org must not use meta refresh" (#7855) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
@ryuyu commented on [Thu Feb 27 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3018)

Currently, the status page uses a <meta> tag to cause the page to refresh.

This is not a11y compliant.
The page should be updated to use a javascript refresh instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""Contact owners" link should not appear on a package details page when there are no owners" (#7853) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
A package details page for a package without any owners still shows the "Contact owners" link on the right. It is unclear what will happen when the message is sent.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Find a package with no owners ([example](https://www.nuget.org/packages/bar/))
2. Look at its package details page
3. See the "Contact owners" link on the right

### Expected behavior
No "Contact owners" link.

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102933/75279548-a1510400-57c0-11ea-8acd-a6d230eb3f83.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Gallery accepts packages containing floating version ranges in dependencies" (#4973) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The following packages have floating versions in their dependency version ranges:

ID | Version
-- | --
Scissorhands.Helpers | 1.0.0-alpha-17
Scissorhands.Helpers | 1.0.0-alpha-16
PInvokeCompiler | 1.0.0-rc1
JWT | 2.3.1

These should be rejected on upload and V3 registrations should strip the floating-ness, as client does:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/bdd8626c0e5c6ee0b505ea8a1274c5fe941fb6d1/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/DependencyInfo/RegistrationUtility.cs#L26

/cc @emgarten

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove the SemVer 2.0.0 warning from nuget.org" (#7836) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

When the SemVer 2.0.0 changes were introduced to the V2 and V3 protocol, they are intended to mitigate the impact of SemVer 2.0.0 packages breaking old clients, e.g. suppose a very popular package released a SemVer 2.0.0 version. In such a case a 2.x customer would fail to restore a package because the version parsing would explode. So we make SemVer 2.0.0 packages "opt-in". 

This protocol change meant that SemVer 2.0.0 packages were hidden in most of our APIs for clients that predate NuGet version 4.3. 4.3 is when the SemVer 2.0.0 protocol was implemented. At that same time we put a warning banner on nuget.org.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/73881689-a223f500-4815-11ea-8717-653f6302cc65.png)
https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Versioning/5.5.0-preview.2.6382

A similar warning is also visible during UI upload and during package push. And during pack (NU5105).

Since 4.3 was shipped so long ago, most clients now support the SemVer 2.0.0 protocol and this warning is more noisy than helpful.

Range | Percent | Note
-- | -- | --
≥ 4.3 | ~96.4% | Supports SemVer 2.0.0 protocol
≥ 3.0 && < 4.3 | ~3.6% | Partial SemVer 2.0.0 but not SemVer 2.0.0 protocol `*`
< 3.0 | ~0.0% | Does not support SemVer 2.0.0

`*` =
- Anything before 4.3 will not see SemVer 2.0.0 in search or in the PM UI.
- 3.5.0 and on supported SemVer 2.0.0 restore in packages.config so people can hand edit to work-around.
- PackageReference always supported SemVer 2.0.0 from what I can tell so people could hard-code a SemVer 2.0.0 package in their .csproj and still restore.
- V3 feeds always return SemVer 2.0.0 packages from flat container so packages can be found prior to SemVer 2.0.0. protocol support

### Describe the solution you'd like

Remove these warnings entirely.

### Additional details

Prompted by https://twitter.com/SimonCropp/status/1169447145939685376, https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7772, and https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5201.

/cc @nkolev92 @SimonCropp @agr @karann-msft

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[CPVM] EnableCentralPackageVersions  name conflict with MsBuild SDK " (#9235) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

The new name EnableCentralPackageVersions conflicts with the Central Package Versions SDK https://github.com/microsoft/MSBuildSdks/blob/f4e31079565777df7656a358777f8db285c4c0bd/src/CentralPackageVersions/Sdk/Sdk.targets#L28-L29

This needs to be changed to avoid the conflict.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "OutputPath logic in Pack targets in a customized build doesn't work properly" (#9234) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack project in NuGet.Client repo

```xml
    <PropertyGroup>
      <PackageOutputPath Condition=" '$(PackageOutputPath)' == '' ">$(OutputPath)</PackageOutputPath>
      <RestoreOutputPath Condition=" '$(RestoreOutputPath)' == '' " >$(MSBuildProjectExtensionsPath)</RestoreOutputPath>
    </PropertyGroup>
```

#### File: [NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(149-152)][ref-lines]

I don't know why but when I try to customise a build relying on Pack targets, the output path logic hits me with so many issues that it doesn't work out of the box.

There are two main issues here,
1. `OutputPath` should be `BaseOutputPath` since, you are generating single package for many targets at once, which is similar to `NuSpecOutputPath` (has `BaseIntermediateOutputPath`).
2. The output paths logic is placed inside a target, which means in a customised build, overriding the target or excluding that particular logic cause path issues.

Related issue SDK side: dotnet/sdk#10730

Fix/Solution: Move the logic out of the target and place it where `NuSpecOutputPath` property is.

Breaks anything: N/A (investigate further by opening a PR)

[ref-lines]: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/64f2febf7d1de8b0228eca5afed97a96c5a30bba/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets#L149-L152

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "document valid-authentication-types better" (#9233) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
